physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient exhibited extensive scarring on the scalp, face, and neck due to the disease and debridement procedures. Active papulopustules and cysts were noted on the face, torso, and suprapubic and intergluteal areas. Interconnected draining sinuses surrounded by macerated nearly verrucous hyperkeratotic skin were observed in the axillae, suprapubic, inguinal, and intergluteal areas. Mild palmoplantar keratoderma and mild keratitis were also present. No oral hyperkeratosis or abnormal dentition was noted, and tonsils were present with no organomegaly.
